tr.td: The AbstractConsumer is the base class for both the Consumer and MultiTopicConsumer classes.
The base class for events that RPC services dispatch.
An invoker is an object that actually executes a remote procedure call (RPC).
Abstract base class for all messages.
The AbstractOperation class represents an individual method on a service.
The AbstractService class is the base class for the WebService and RemoteObject classes.
This class provides the basic functionality required by the logging framework for a target implementation.
AbstractWebService is an abstract base class for implementations that provide RPC access to SOAP-based web services.
The Accessibility class manages communication with screen readers.
The AccessibilityProperties class lets you control the presentation of Flash objects to accessibility aids, such as screen readers.
An Accordion navigator container has a collection of child containers, but only one of them at a time is visible.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Accordion class.
The AccordionHeader class defines the appearance of the navigation buttons of an Accordion.
The skin for all the states of an AccordionHeader in an Accordion.
An AcknowledgeMessage acknowledges the receipt of a message that was sent previously.
The ActionEffectInstance class is the superclass for all action effect instance classes.
The ActionScriptVersion class is an enumeration of constant values that indicate the language version of a loaded SWF file.
Defines the up, down, and over states for MenuBarItem objects.
A Camera or Microphone object dispatches an ActivityEvent object whenever a camera or microphone reports that it has become active or inactive.
The AddChild class adds a child display object, such as a component, to a container as part of a view state.
The AddChildAction class defines an action effect that corresponds to the AddChild property of a view state definition.
The AddChildActionInstance class implements the instance class for the AddChildAction effect.

The AddItemAction class defines an action effect that determines when the item renderer appears in the control for an item being added to a list-based control, such as List or TileList, or for an item that replaces an existing item in the control.
The AddItemActionInstance class implements the instance class for the AddItemAction effect.
The AdvancedDataGrid control expands on the functionality of the standard DataGrid control to add data visualization features to your Adobe Flex application.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridBase class is the base class for controls that display lists of items in multiple columns, such as the AdvancedDataGrid and OLAPDataGrid controls.
The AdvancedDataGridBaseEx class is a base class of the AdvancedDataGrid control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridBaseSelectionData class defines a data structure used by the advanced data grid classes to track selected cells in the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridColumn class describes a column in an AdvancedDataGrid control.
Use the AdvancedDataGridColumnGroup class to specify column groups for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridDragProxy class defines the default drag proxy used when dragging data from an AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridEvent class represents event objects that are specific to the AdvancedDataGrid control, such as the event that is dispatched when an editable grid item gets the focus.
The AdvancedDataGridEventReason class defines constants for the values of the reason property of a AdvancedDataGridEvent object when the type property is itemEditEnd.
The AdvancedDataGridGroupItemRenderer class defines the default item renderer for the nodes of the navigation tree.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AdvancedDataGridGroupItemRenderer class.
The skin for the separator between column headers in an AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridHeaderInfo class contains information that describes the hierarchy of the columns of the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridHeaderRenderer class defines the default header renderer for a AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridHeaderShiftEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched when an AdvancedDataGrid control's header item is shifted.
The AdvancedDataGridItemRenderer class defines the default item renderer for a AdvancedDataGrid control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AdvancedDataGridItemRenderer class.
The AdvancedDataGridItemSelectEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched when an item in a AdvancedDataGrid control header item is selected or deselected.
The AdvancedDataGridListData class defines the data type of the listData property implemented by drop-in item renderers or drop-in item editors for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridRendererDescription class contains information that describes an item renderer for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
An AdvancedDataGridRendererProvider instance defines the characteristics for a single item renderer used by the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The AdvancedDataGridSortItemRenderer class defines the item renderer for the sort icon and text field in the column header of the AdvancedDataGrid control.

The AdvancedListBase class is the base class for controls, such as the AdvancedDataGrid and OLAPDataGrid controls, that represent lists of items that can have one or more selected items and can scroll through the items.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AdvancedListBase class.
The AIREvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for several AIR-specific events dispatched by the Window and WindowedApplication components.
The Alert control is a pop-up dialog box that can contain a message, a title, buttons (any combination of OK, Cancel, Yes, and No) and an icon.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Alert control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AlertForm class.
The AMFChannel class provides the AMF support for messaging.
The AnimateProperty effect animates a property or style of a component.
The AnimatePropertyInstance class implements the instance class for the AnimateProperty effect.
The AntiAliasType class provides values for anti-aliasing in the flash.text.TextField class.
Flex defines a default, or Application, container that lets you start adding content to your application without explicitly defining another container.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Application class.
The ApplicationControlBar container holds components that provide global navigation and application commands.
The ApplicationDomain class is a container for discrete groups of class definitions.
The skin for the TitleBar of a WindowedApplication or Window.
The AreaChart control represents data as an area bounded by a line connecting the values in the data.
The default class used to render the area beneath the dataPoints of an AreaSeries object.
Defines a data series for an AreaChart control.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AreaSeries class.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of an AreaSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the AreaSeries to render.
A grouping set that can be used to stack AreaSeries objects in any chart.
The ArgumentError class represents an error that occurs when the arguments supplied in a function do not match the arguments defined for that function.
An arguments object is used to store and access a function's arguments.
The Array class lets you access and manipulate arrays.
The ArrayCollection class is a wrapper class that exposes an Array as a collection that can be accessed and manipulated using the methods and properties of the ICollectionView or IList interfaces.
The ArrayUtil utility class is an all-static class with methods for working with arrays within Flex.
An object dispatches an AsyncErrorEvent when an exception is thrown from native asynchronous code, which could be from, for example, LocalConnection, NetConnection, SharedObject, or NetStream.
AsyncMessage is the base class for all asynchronous messages.
The AsyncRequest class provides an abstraction of messaging for RPC call invocation.
This class provides an RPC specific implementation of mx.rpc.IResponder.
This class provides a place to set additional or token-level data for asynchronous RPC operations.
The Automation class defines the entry point for the Flex Automation framework.
The AutomationDragEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched as part of a drag-and-drop operation.
The AutomationDragEventWithPositionInfo class represents event objects that are dispatched as part of a drag-and-drop operation.
The AutomationError class defines the error constants used by the Flex Automation mechanism.
The AutomationEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched by the AutomationManager.
The Flex automation framework uses the AutomationID class to build object identification that Agents can use.
The AutomationIDPart class represents a component instance to agents.
The AutomationRecordEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched by the AutomationManager.

The AutomationReplayEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched by the AutomationManager, and used by the functional testing classes and any other classes that must replay user interactions.
The AverageAggregator class implements the average aggregator.
AVM1Movie is a simple class that represents AVM1 movie clips, which use ActionScript 1.0 or 2.0.
The AxisBase class serves as a base class for the various axis types supported in Flex.
An AxisLabel object represents a single label on the chart axis.
An AxisLabelSet represents the label and tick data generated by an implementation of IAxis.
You use the AxisRenderer class to describe the horizontal and vertical axes of a chart.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the AxisRenderer class.
The Back class defines three easing functions to implement motion with Flex effect classes.
The BarChart control represents data as a series of horizontal bars whose length is determined by values in the data.
Defines a data series for a BarChart control.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the BarSeries class.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of a BarSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the BarSeries to render.
A grouping set that can be used to stack or cluster BarSeries objects in any chart.
A utility class to decode a Base64 encoded String to a ByteArray.
A utility class to encode a String or ByteArray as a Base64 encoded String.
The BaseListData class defines the data type of the listData property implemented by drop-in item renderers or drop-in item editors.
The BevelFilter class lets you add a bevel effect to display objects.
The BindingUtils class defines utility methods for performing data binding from ActionScript.
The Bitmap class represents display objects that represent bitmap images.
BitmapAsset is a subclass of the flash.display.Bitmap class which represents bitmap images that you embed in a Flex application.
The BitmapData class lets you work with the data (pixels) of a Bitmap object bitmap image.
The BitmapDataChannel class is an enumeration of constant values that indicate which channel to use: red, blue, green, or alpha transparency.
Defines a set of values used to fill an area on screen with a bitmap or other DisplayObject.
The BitmapFilter class is the base class for all image filter effects.
The BitmapFilterQuality class contains values to set the rendering quality of a BitmapFilter object.
The BitmapFilterType class contains values to set the type of a BitmapFilter.
A class that provides constant values for visual blend mode effects.
The Blur effect lets you apply a blur visual effect to a component.
The BlurFilter class lets you apply a blur visual effect to display objects.
The BlurInstance class implements the instance class for the Blur effect.
A Boolean object is a data type that can have one of two values, either true or false, used for logical operations.
The Border class is an abstract base class for various classes that draw borders, either rectangular or non-rectangular, around UIComponents.
The Bounce class defines three easing functions to implement bounce motion with Flex effect classes.
A bounded value is used to represent a datapoint that a chart element intends to render on screen.
A Box container lays out its children in a single vertical column or a single horizontal row.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Box class.
The BoxDirection class specifies constant values for the direction property of the Box container.
The BoxDivider class represents the divider between children of a DividedBox container.
A simple chart itemRenderer implementation that fills a rectangular area.
The skin for the border of a SWFLoader or Image component when the content could not be loaded.
The BrowserChangeEvent class represents event objects specific to the BrowserManager.

The NativeApplication object of an AIR application dispatches a BrowserInvokeEvent event when the application is invoked as the result of a SWF file in the browser using the browser invocation feature.
The BrowserManager is a Singleton manager that acts as a proxy between the browser and the application.
The BubbleChart control represents data with three values for each data point.
Defines a data series for a BubbleChart control.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the BubbleSeries class.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of a BubbleSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the BubbleSeries to render.
The Button control is a commonly used rectangular button.
ButtonAsset is a subclass of the flash.display.SimpleButton class which represents button symbols that you embed in a Flex application from a SWF file produced by Flash.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Button control.
The ButtonBar control defines a horizontal or vertical group of logically related push buttons with a common look and navigation.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ButtonBar control.
The skin for all the states of the ButtonBarButtons in a ButtonBar.
The ButtonLabelPlacement class defines the constants for the allowed values of the labelPlacement property of a Button, CheckBox, LinkButton, or RadioButton control.
The skin for all the states of a Button.
The ByteArray class provides methods and properties to optimize reading, writing, and working with binary data.
ByteArrayAsset is a subclass of the flash.utils.ByteArray class which represents an arbitrary sequence of byte data that you embed in a Flex application.
The CalendarLayoutChangeEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for the change event for the DateChooser and DateField controls.
Use the Camera class to capture video from a camera attached to a computer running Flash Player.
The CandlestickChart control represents financial data as a series of candlesticks representing the high, low, opening, and closing values of a data series.
The default itemRenderer for a CandlestickSeries object.
Represents financial data as a series of candlesticks representing the high, low, opening, and closing values of a data series.
A Canvas layout container defines a rectangular region in which you place child containers and controls.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Canvas class.
The Capabilities class provides properties that describe the system and player that are hosting a SWF file.
The CapsStyle class is an enumeration of constant values that specify the caps style to use in drawing lines.
Defines the position of objects on a data canvas.
The CartesianChart class is a base class for the common chart types.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the CartesianChart base class.
This class lets you use add graphical elements such as lines, ellipses, and other shapes by using a graphics API.
The CartesianTransform object represents a set of axes sed to map data values to x/y Cartesian screen coordinates and vice versa.
The CategoryAxis class lets charts represent data grouped by a set of discrete values along an axis.
The ChangeWatcher class defines utility methods that you can use with bindable Flex properties.
The Channel class is the base message channel class that all channels in the messaging system must extend.
This is the base class for any channel related errors.
The ChannelEvent is used to propagate channel events within the messaging system.
The ChannelFaultEvent class is used to propagate channel fault events within the messaging system.
The ChannelSet is a set of Channels that are used to send messages to a target destination.
The ChartBase class is the link between the Flex component architecture and the DualStyleObject architecture.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ChartBase base class.
The ChartElement class is the base class for visual chart elements.
The ChartEvent class represents events that are specific to the chart control, such as when a chart is clicked.
A ChartItem represents a single item in a ChartSeries.
The default drag proxy used when dragging items from a chart control.
The ChartItemEvent class represents events that are specific to the chart components, such as when a chart item is clicked.
Draws data labels on chart controls.
The ListItemSelectEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched when an item in a list-based control such as a Menu, DataGrid, or Tree control is selected or deselected.
Describes the current state of a chart.
The CheckBox control consists of an optional label and a small box that can contain a check mark or not.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the CheckBox control.
The skin for all the states of the icon in a CheckBox.
Represents events that are dispatched when a the child of a control is created or destroyed.
This error is thrown when retrieving a child item from a collection view requires an asynchronous call.
A simple chart itemRenderer implementation that fills an elliptical area.
The Circular class defines three easing functions to implement circular motion with Flex effect classes.
A Class object is created for each class definition in a program.
A ClassFactory instance is a "factory object" which Flex uses to generate instances of another class, each with identical properties.
Provides a container for transferring data and objects through the clipboard and through drag-and-drop operations.
Defines constants for the names of the standard data formats used with the Clipboard class.
Defines constants for the modes used as values of the transferMode parameter of the Clipboard.getData() method.
The CloseEvent class represents event objects specific to popup windows, such as the Alert control.
The mx.events.CollectionEvent class represents an event that is dispatched when the associated collection changes.
The CollectionEventKind class contains constants for the valid values of the mx.events.CollectionEvent class kind property.
The CollectionViewError class represents general errors within a collection that are not related to specific activities such as Cursor seeking.

The ColorMatrixFilter class lets you apply a 4 x 5 matrix transformation on the RGBA color and alpha values of every pixel in the input image to produce a result with a new set of RGBA color and alpha values.
The ColorPicker control provides a way for a user to choose a color from a swatch list.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ColorPicker control.
Represents events that are specific to the ColorPicker control, such as when the user rolls the mouse over or out of a swatch in the swatch panel.
The skin for all the states of a ColorPicker.
The ColorTransform class lets you adjust the color values in a display object.
The ColorUtil class is an all-static class with methods for working with RGB colors within Flex.
The ColumnChart control represents data as a series of vertical columns whose height is determined by values in the data.
Defines a data series for a ColumnChart control.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ColumnSeries class.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of a ColumnSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the ColumnSeries to render.
ColumnSet is a grouping set that can be used to stack or cluster column series in any arbitrary chart.
The ComboBase class is the base class for controls that display text in a text field and have a button that causes a drop-down list to appear where the user can choose which text to display.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ComboBase class.
The ComboBox control contains a drop-down list from which the user can select a single value.
The skin for all the states of the button in a ComboBox.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ComboBox control.

The CommandMessage class provides a mechanism for sending commands to the server infrastructure, such as commands related to publish/subscribe messaging scenarios, ping operations, and cluster operations.
ComponentDescriptor is the base class for the UIComponentDescriptor class, which encapsulates the information that you specified in an MXML tag for an instance of a visual component.
The CompositeEffect class is the parent class for the Parallel and Sequence classes, which define the parallel and sequence MXML tags.
The CompositeEffectInstance class implements the instance class for the CompositeEffect class.
Defines string constants for the names of compress and uncompress options.
Concurrency is set via MXML based access to RPC services to indicate how to handle multiple calls to the same service.
The ConfigMap class provides a mechanism to store the properties returned by the server with the ordering of the properties maintained.
The ConstraintColumn class partitions an absolutely positioned container in the vertical plane.
ConstraintRow class partitions an absolutely positioned container in the horizontal plane.
A Consumer subscribes to a destination to receive messages.
The Container class is an abstract base class for components that controls the layout characteristics of child components.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Container class.
The ContainerCreationPolicy class defines the constant values for the creationPolicy property of the Container class.
The ContainerLayout class defines the constant values for the layout property of container classes.
Container components created in Adobe Flash CS3 Professional for use in Flex are subclasses of the mx.flash.ContainerMovieClip class.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ContainerMovieClip control.
The ContextMenu class provides control over the items in the Flash Player context menu.
The ContextMenuBuiltInItems class describes the items that are built in to a context menu.
An object dispatches a ContextMenuEvent object when the user generates or interacts with the context menu.
Use the ContextMenuItem class to create custom menu items to display in the Flash Player context menu.
A class factory that provides a system manager as a context of where the class should be created.
The ControlBar container lets you place controls at the bottom of a Panel or TitleWindow container.
The ConvolutionFilter class applies a matrix convolution filter effect.
The CountAggregator class implements the count aggregator.
The CreditCardValidator class validates that a credit card number is the correct length, has the correct prefix, and passes the Luhn mod10 algorithm for the specified card type.
The CreditCardValidatorCardType class defines value constants for specifying the type of credit card to validate.
Cross-domain RSL Item Class.
A simple chart itemRenderer implementation that fills a cross in its assigned area.
The CSMSettings class contains properties for use with the TextRenderer.setAdvancedAntiAliasingTable() method to provide continuous stroke modulation (CSM).
The CSSStyleDeclaration class represents a set of CSS style rules.
Event class used by OLAPCube to indicate its status.
The Cubic class defines three easing functions to implement motion with Flex effect classes.
The CuePointEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for cue point events dispatched by the VideoDisplay control.
The CuePointManager class lets you use ActionScript code to manage the cue points associated with the VideoDisplay control.
The CurrencyFormatter class formats a valid number as a currency value.
The CurrencyValidator class ensures that a String represents a valid currency expression.
The CurrencyValidatorAlignSymbol class defines value constants for specifying currency symbol alignment.
Encapsulates the positional aspects of a cursor in an ICollectionView.
This error is thrown by a collection Cursor.
The CursorManager class controls a prioritized list of cursors, where the cursor with the highest priority is currently visible.
The CursorManagerPriority class defines the constant values for the priority argument to the CursorManager.setCursor() method.
The DataDescription structure is used by ChartElements to describe the characteristics of the data they represent to Axis objects that auto-generate values from the data represented in the chart.
An object dispatches a DataEvent object when raw data has completed loading.
The DataGrid control is like a List except that it can show more than one column of data making it suited for showing objects with multiple properties.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DataGrid control.
The DataGridBase class is the base class for controls that display lists of items in multiple columns.
The DataGridColumn class describes a column in a DataGrid control.
The skin for the column drop indicator in a DataGrid.
The skin for the column resizer in a DataGrid.
The DataGridDragProxy class defines the default drag proxy used when dragging data from a DataGrid control.
The DataGridEvent class represents event objects that are specific to the DataGrid control, such as the event that is dispatched when an editable grid item gets the focus.
The DataGridEventReason class defines constants for the values of the reason property of a DataGridEvent object when the type property is itemEditEnd.
The DataGridHeader class defines the default header renderer for a DataGrid control.
The skin for the background of the column headers in a DataGrid control.
The DataGridHeaderBase class defines the base class for the DataGridHeader class, the class that defines the item renderer for the DataGrid control.
The skin for the separator between column headers in a DataGrid.
The DataGridItemRenderer class defines the default item renderer for a DataGrid control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DataGridItemRenderer class.
The DataGridListData class defines the data type of the listData property that is implemented by drop-in item renderers or drop-in item editors for the DataGrid control.
The DataGridLockedRowContentHolder class defines a container in a DataGrid control of all of the control's item renderers and item editors.
The skin for the sort arrow in a column header in a DataGrid.
The DataTip control provides information about a data point to chart users.
The DataTransform object represents a portion of a chart that contains glyphs and can transform values to screen coordinates and vice versa.
The Date class represents date and time information.
The DateBase class contains the localized string information used by the mx.formatters.DateFormatter class and the parsing function that renders the pattern.
The DateChooser control displays the name of a month, the year, and a grid of the days of the month, with columns labeled for the day of the week.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DateChooser control.
The DateChooserEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for the scroll event for the DateChooser and DateField controls.
Constants that define the values of the detail property of a DateChooserEvent object.
The skins of the DateChooser's indicators for displaying today, rollover and selected dates.
The skin for all the states of the next-month and previous-month buttons in a DateChooser.
The skin for all the states of the next-year and previous-year buttons in a DateChooser.
The DateField control is a text field that shows the date with a calendar icon on its right side.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DateField control.
The DateFormatter class uses a format String to return a formatted date and time String from an input String or a Date object.
A set of disabled date range utilities used by DateTimeAxis
The DateTimeAxis class maps time values evenly between a minimum and maximum value along a chart axis.
The DateValidator class validates that a String, Date, or Object contains a proper date and matches a specified format.
The DefaultDataDescriptor class provides a default implementation for accessing and manipulating data for use in controls such as Tree and Menu.
The DefaultListEffect class defines the default effect applied to the item renderers of a List control when the data in the data provider changes.
The DefaultTileListEffect class defines the default effect applied to the item renderers of a TileList control when the data in the data provider changes.
A deferred instance factory that creates and returns an instance of a specified class.
A deferred instance factory that uses a generator function to create an instance of the required object.
The DefinitionError class represents an error that occurs when user code attempts to define an identifier that is already defined.
The DeleteObjectSample class represents objects that are created within a getSamples() stream; each DeleteObjectSample object corresponds to a NewObjectSample object.
DescribeTypeCache is a convenience class that is used to cache the return values of flash.utils.describeType() so that calls made subsequent times return faster.
This class represents a single cache entry, this gets created as part of the describeType method call on the DescribeTypeCache class.
A simple chart itemRenderer implementation that fills a diamond in its assigned area.
The Dictionary class lets you create a dynamic collection of properties, which uses strict equality (===) for key comparison on non-primitive object keys.
The DisplacementMapFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified BitmapData object (called the displacement map image) to perform a displacement of an object.
The DisplacementMapFilterMode class provides values for the mode property of the DisplacementMapFilter class.
The DisplayObject class is the base class for all objects that can be placed on the display list.
The DisplayObjectContainer class is the base class for all objects that can serve as display object containers on the display list.
Animate the component from transparent to opaque, or from opaque to transparent.
The DissolveInstance class implements the instance class for the Dissolve effect.
A DividedBox container measures and lays out its children horizontally or vertically in exactly the same way as a Box container, but it inserts draggable dividers in the gaps between the children.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DividedBox class.
Represents events that are dispatched when a divider has been pressed, dragged or released.
The DockIcon class represents the OS X-style dock icon.
The DownloadProgressBar class displays download progress.
The DragEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched as part of a drag-and-drop operation.
The DragManager class manages drag and drop operations, which let you move data from one place to another in a Flex application.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the DragManager class.
The DragSource class contains the data being dragged.
Dispatched when a NetStream object tries to play digital rights management (DRM) encrypted content that requires a user credential for authentication.
AIR dispatches a DRMErrorEvent object when a NetStream object, trying to play a digital rights management (DRM) encrypted file, encounters a DRM-related error.

A NetStream object dispatches a DRMStatusEvent object when the content protected using Digital Rights Management (DRM) begins playing successfully (when the voucher is verified, and when the user is authenticated and authorized to view the content).
The DropdownEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for the open and close events.
The DropShadowFilter class lets you add a drop shadow to display objects.
The DualStyleObject class serves as a base class for components that have a need to assign class selectors outside of the client developer's control.
This subclass of Event is dynamic, meaning that you can set arbitrary event properties on its instances at runtime.
The EdgeMetrics class specifies the thickness, in pixels, of the four edge regions around a visual component.
The Effect class is an abstract base class that defines the basic functionality of all Flex effects.
Represents event objects that are specific to Flex effects.
The EffectInstance class represents an instance of an effect playing on a target.
The EffectManager class listens for events, such as the show and move events, dispatched by objects in a Flex application.
The EffectTargetFilter class defines a custom filter that is executed by each transition effect on each target of the effect.
The Elastc class defines three easing functions to implement motion with Flex effect classes, where the motion is defined by an exponentially decaying sine wave.
The EmailValidator class validates that a String has a single @ sign, a period in the domain name and that the top-level domain suffix has two, three, four, or six characters.
The EncryptedLocalStore class provides methods for setting and getting objects in the encrypted local data store for an AIR application.
The Endian class contains values that denote the byte order used to represent multibyte numbers.
An EOFError exception is thrown when you attempt to read past the end of the available data.
The Error class contains information about an error that occurred in a script.
An object dispatches an ErrorEvent object when an error causes a network operation to fail.
The ErrorMessage class is used to report errors within the messaging system.
The EvalError class represents an error that occurs when user code calls the eval() function or attempts to use the new operator with the Function object.
The Event class is used as the base class for the creation of Event objects, which are passed as parameters to event listeners when an event occurs.
The EventDispatcher class is the base class for all runtime classes that dispatch events.
The EventPhase class provides values for the eventPhase property of the Event class.
The EventPriority class defines constant values for the priority argument of the addEventListener() method of EventDispatcher.
The Exponential class defines three easing functions to implement motion with Flex effect classes, where the motion is defined by an exponentially decaying sine wave.

The ExternalInterface class is the External API, an application programming interface that enables straightforward communication between ActionScript and the Flash Player container– for example, an HTML page with JavaScript.
The Fade effect animates the alpha property of a component, either from transparent to opaque, or from opaque to transparent.
The FadeInstance class implements the instance class for the Fade effect.
Object that represents a fault in a remote procedure call (RPC) service invocation.
This event is dispatched when an RPC call has a fault.
A File object represents a path to a file or directory.
The FileEvent class represents event objects that are specific to the FileSystemList, FileSystemDataGrid, FileSystemTree and FileSystemComboBox controls.

The FileFilter class is used to indicate what files on the user's system are shown in the file-browsing dialog box that is displayed when the FileReference.browse() method, the FileReferenceList.browse() method is called or a browse method of a File, FileReference, or FileReferenceList object is called.

A File object dispatches a FileListEvent object when a call to the getDirectoryListingAsync() method of a File object successfully enumerates a set of files and directories or when a user selects files after a call to the browseForOpenMultiple() method.
The FileMode class defines string constants used in the fileMode parameter of the open() and openAsync() methods of the FileStream class.
The FileReference class provides a means to upload and download files between a user's computer and a server.
The FileReferenceList class provides a means to let users select one or more files for uploading.
A FileStream object is used to read and write files.
The FileSystemComboBox control defines a combo box control for navigating up the chain of ancestor directories from a specified directory in a file system.
The FileSystemDataGrid control lets you display the contents of a single file system directory in a data grid format.
The FileSystemEnumerationMode class defines the constant values for the enumerationMode property of the FileSystemList, FileSystemDataGrid, and FileSystemTree classes.
The FileSystemHistoryButton control defines a single control with two buttons: a main button on the left and a secondary button on the right.
The FileSystemList control lets you display the contents of a single file system directory, in a list format.
The FileSystemSizeDisplayMode class defines the constant values for the sizeDisplayMode property of the FileSystemDataGrid class.
The FileSystemTree control displays the contents of a file system directory as a tree.
FlexBitmap is a subclass of the Player's Bitmap class.
Singleton class that stores the global Id for this Player instance that is server assigned when the client makes its initial connection to the server.
The FlexContentHolder class is for internal use only.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the FlexContentHolder control.
The FlexEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for many Flex events.
FlexHTMLLoader is a subclass of the Player's HTMLLoader class used by the Flex HTML control.
The FlexMouseEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for Flex-specific mouse activity.
FlexMovieClip is a subclass of the Player's MovieClip class.
The FlexNativeMenu component provides a wrapper for AIR's NativeMenu class.

The FlexNativeWindowBoundsEvent is dispatched when the size or location changes for the NativeWindow that underlies a Window or WindowedApplication component.
The FlexPrintJob class is a wrapper for the flash.printing.PrintJob class.
Values for the scaleType property of the FlexPrintJob.addObject() method parameter.
FlexShape is a subclass of the Player's Shape class.
FlexSimpleButton is a subclass of the Player's SimpleButton class.
FlexSprite is a subclass of the Player's Sprite class and the superclass of UIComponent.
FlexTextField is a subclass of the Player's TextField class and the superclass of UITextField.
This class controls the backward-compatibility of the framework.
The FocusDirection class enumerates values to be used for the direction parameter of the assignFocus() method of a Stage object and for the direction property of a FocusEvent object.
An object dispatches a FocusEvent object when the user changes the focus from one object in the display list to another.
The FocusManager class manages the focus on components in response to mouse activity or keyboard activity (Tab key).
The Font class is used to manage embedded fonts in SWF files.

The FontStyle class provides values for the TextRenderer class.
The FontType class contains the enumerated constants "embedded" and "device" for the fontType property of the Font class.

The Form container lets you control the layout of a form, mark form fields as required or optional, handle error messages, and bind your form data to the Flex data model to perform data checking and validation.
The Formatter class is the base class for all data formatters.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Form class.
The FormHeading container is used to display a heading for a group of controls inside a Form container.

Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the FormItem class.
The FormItemDirection class defines the constant values for the direction property of the FormItem class.
The FormItem container uses a FormItemLabel object to display the label portion of the FormItem container.
The FrameLabel object contains properties that specify a frame number and the corresponding label name.
Flash® Player or the Apollo runtime dispatches a FullScreenEvent object whenever the Stage enters or leaves full-screen display mode.
A function is the basic unit of code that can be invoked in ActionScript.
The Glow effect lets you apply a visual glow effect to a component.
The GlowFilter class lets you apply a glow effect to display objects.
The GlowInstance class implements the instance class for the Glow effect.
The GradientBase class is the base class for LinearGradient, LinearGradientStroke, and RadialGradient.
The GradientBevelFilter class lets you apply a gradient bevel effect to display objects.
The GradientEntry class defines the objects that control a transition as part of a gradient fill.
The GradientGlowFilter class lets you apply a gradient glow effect to display objects.
The GradientType class provides values for the type parameter in the beginGradientFill() and lineGradientStyle() methods of the flash.display.Graphics class.
The Graphics class contains a set of methods that you can use to create a vector shape.
The Graphics class is an all-static class with utility methods related to the Graphics class.
A Grid container lets you arrange children as rows and columns of cells, similar to an HTML table.
The GridFitType class defines values for grid fitting in the TextField class.
The GridItem container defines a grid cell in GridRow container.
The GridLines class draws grid lines inside the data area of the chart.
The GridRow container defines a row in a Grid container, and contains GridCell containers.
The Grouping class defines the fields in the data provider of the AdvancedDataGrid control used to group data.
The GroupingCollection class lets you create grouped data from flat data for display in the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The GroupingField class represents individual data fields that you use to group flat data for display by the AdvancedDataGrid control.
Defines the appearance of the default border for the Halo theme.
Defines the colors used by components that support the Halo theme.
Initializes the core default styles for the charts classes.
Defines the skin for the focus indicator.
The HBox container lays out its children in a single horizontal row.
The HDividedBox container lays out its children horizontally in the same way as HBox container, but it inserts a draggable divider in the gap between each child.
The event that indicates an RPC operation, such as a WebService SOAP request, returned a header in the response.
The HierarchicalCollectionView class provides a hierarchical view of a standard collection.
The HierarchicalCollectionViewCursor class defines a cursor for a hierarchical view of a standard collection.
Hierarchical data is data already in a structure of parent and child data items.
History management lets users navigate through a Flex application using the web browser's Back and Forward navigation commands.
The HitData class represents information about the data item at a specific location on the screen.
The HLOCChart (High Low Open Close) control represents financial data as a series of elements representing the high, low, closing, and optionally opening values of a data series.
The default item renderer for an HLOCSeries object.
Represents financial data as a series of elements representing the high, low, closing, and, optionally, opening values of a data series.
HLOCSeriesBase is the base class for the two financial series types, HLOCSeries and CandlestickSeries.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the CandlestickSeries and HLOCSeries classes.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of a HLOCSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the HLOCSeries and CandlestickSeries objects to render.
The HorizontalList control displays a horizontal list of items.
The HRule control creates a single horizontal line.
The HScrollBar (horizontal ScrollBar) control lets you control the portion of data that is displayed when there is too much data to fit in a display area.
The HSlider control lets users select a value by moving a slider thumb between the end points of the slider track.
The HTML control lets you display HTML content in your application.
Describes a location in the navigation history of an HTMLLoader object.
Controls behaviors of an HTMLLoader object for user interface elements that can be controlled by setting various properties or calling various methods of the window object of the HTML page.
The HTMLLoader class defines a type of display object that is a container for HTML content.
The HTMLPDFCapability class contains possible values of the pdfCapability property of an HTMLLoader object.
An HTMLLoader object dispatches an HTMLUncaughtScriptExceptionEvent object whenever a JavaScript exception is thrown and not handled with a catch statement.
Defines the options that can be specified when JavaScript running in an HTMLLoader tries to create a new HTML window, by calling the window.open() method.
The HTTPChannel class provides the HTTP support for messaging.
HTTP requests are sent to the HTTP endpoint using this message type.
You use the httpservice tag to represent an HTTPService object in an MXML file.
You use the httpservice tag to represent an HTTPService object in an MXML file.
The application dispatches HTTPStatusEvent objects when a network request returns an HTTP status code.
The IAbstractEffect interface is used to denote that a property or parameter must be of type Effect, but does not actually implement any of the APIs of the IEffect interface.
The IAdvancedDataGridRendererProvider interface defines the interface implemented by the AdvancedDataGridRendererProvider class, which defines the item renderer for the AdvancedDataGrid control.
The IAutomationClass interface defines the interface for a component class descriptor.
The IAutomationEnvironment interface provides information about the objects and properties of automatable components needed for communicating with agents.
The IAutomationEventDescriptor interface defines the interface for an event descriptor.
The IAutomationManager interface defines the interface expected from an AutomationManager object by the automation module.
The IAutomationMethodDescriptor interface defines the interface for a method descriptor.

The IAutomationMouseSimulator interface describes an object that simulates mouse movement so that components capturing the mouse use the simulated versions of the mouse cursor instead of the live Flash Player version.
The IAutomationObject interface defines the interface for a delegate object that implements automation for a component.
The IAutomationObjectHelper interface defines helper methods for IAutomationObjects.
The IAutomationPropertyDescriptor interface describes a property of a test object.
The IAutomationTabularData interface is implemented by components which can provide their content information in a tabular form.
The IAxis class is an abstract interface for defining label, tick mark, and data positioning properties for a chart axis.
The IAxis class is an abstract interface for defining label, tick mark, and data positioning properties for a chart axis.
The IBar interface is implemented by any any series that can be clustered vertically, such as a BarSeries.
The IBitmapDrawable interface is implemented by objects that can be passed as the source parameter of the draw() method of the BitmapData class.
The IBorder interface defines the interface that all classes used for border skins should implement.
The interface that the shared instance of the BrowserManager implements.
The IButton interface is a marker interface that indicates that a component acts as a button.
IChartElement defines the base set of properties and methods required by a UIComponent to be representable in the data space of a chart.
IChartElement2 defines the base set of properties and methods required by a UIComponent to be representable in the data space of a chart.
The IChildList interface defines the properties and methods for accessing and manipulating child lists, which are subsets of a DisplayObjectContainer's children.
An ICollectionView is a view onto a collection of data.
ChartElements that can be clustered along the vertical axis should implement this interface.
Represents an operating system icon.
The IConstraintClient interface defines the interface for components that support layout constraints.
IConstraintLayout is a marker interface that indicates that a container supports ConstraintColumn class and ConstraintRow class within its layout.
IContainer is a interface that indicates a component extends or mimics mx.core.Container
The ID3Info class contains properties that reflect ID3 metadata.
The IDataInput interface provides a set of methods for reading binary data.
The IDataOutput interface provides a set of methods for writing binary data.
The IDataRenderer interface defines the interface for components that have a data property.
The IDeferredInstance interface defines the Flex deferred instance factory interface.
The IDeferredInstantiationUIComponent interface defines the interface for a component or object that defers instantiation.
The interface for "drop-in" item renderers.
This interface controls the serialization of dynamic properties of dynamic objects.
This interface is used with the IDynamicPropertyOutput interface to control the serialization of dynamic properties of dynamic objects.
The IEffect interface defines the base interface of all Flex effects.
The IEffectInstance interface represents an instance of an effect playing on a target.
The IEffectTargetHost interface defines the interface that lets you access the target list-based control of a data effect.
The IEventDispatcher interface defines methods for adding or removing event listeners, checks whether specific types of event listeners are registered, and dispatches events.
The IExternalizable interface provides control over serialization of a class as it is encoded into a data stream.
The IFactory interface defines the interface that factory classes such as ClassFactory must implement.
Defines the interface that classes that perform a fill must implement.

IFlexAsset is a marker interface with the following meaning: if a class declares that it implements IFlexAsset, then that class represents an asset -- such as a bitmap, a font, or a sound -- that has been embedded in a Flex application.
The IFlexContextMenu interface defines the interface for a Flex context menus.
The IFlexDisplayObject interface defines the interface for skin elements.
The IFlexModule interface is used as an optional contract with IFlexModuleFactory.

The IFocusManager interface defines the interface that components must implement to manage the focus on components in response to mouse activity or keyboard activity (Tab key), and to support a default button.

The IFocusManagerComponent interface defines the interface that focusable components must implement in order to receive focus from the FocusManager.
The IFocusManagerContainer interface defines the interface that containers implement to host a FocusManager.
The IFocusManagerGroup interface defines the interface that any component must implement if it is grouped in sets, where only one member of the set can be selected at any given time.
Allows a component to support a font context property.
The IGroupingCollection interface defines the interface required to create grouped data from flat data.
The IHierarchicalCollectionView interface defines an interface for hierarchical or grouped data.
The IHierarchicalCollectionViewCursor interface defines the interface for enumerating a hierarchical collection view bidirectionally.
The IHierarchicalData interface defines the interface used to represent hierarchical data as the data provider for a Flex component.
Interface that must be implemented by objects registered with the History Manager.

The IImageEncoder interface defines the interface that image encoders implement to take BitmapData objects, or ByteArrays containing raw ARGB pixels, as input and convert them to popular image formats such as PNG or JPEG.
The IIMESupport interface defines the interface for any component that supports IME (input method editor).
The IInvalidating interface defines the interface for components that use invalidation to do delayed -- rather than immediate -- property commitment, measurement, drawing, and layout.
The LayoutManager is the engine behind Flex's measurement and layout strategy.
The ILayoutManagerClient interface defines the interface that a component must implement to participate in the LayoutManager's commit/measurement/layout sequence.
A collection of items organized in an ordinal fashion.
Item renderers and item editors for list components must implement the IListItemRenderer interface.
The IllegalOperationError exception is thrown when a method is not implemented or the implementation doesn't cover the current usage.
All loggers within the logging framework must implement this interface.
All logger target implementations within the logging framework must implement this interface.
The Image control lets you import JPEG, PNG, GIF, and SWF files at runtime.
A helper class used to capture a snapshot of any Flash component that implements flash.display.IBitmapDrawable, including Flex UIComponents.
The IME class lets you directly manipulate the operating system's input method editor (IME) in the Flash Player application that is running on a client computer.
This class contains constants for use with the IME.conversionMode property.
An IMEEvent object is dispatched when the user enters text using an input method editor (IME).
The IMenuBarItemRenderer interface defines the interface that an item renderer for the top-level menu bar of a MenuBar control must implement.
The IMenuDataDescriptor interface defines the interface that a dataDescriptor for a Menu or MenuBar control must implement.
The IMenuItemRenderer interface defines the interface that a menu item renderer for a Menu control must implement.
This interface defines the contract for message objects.
An interface that acts as a handle for a particular module.
The IMXMLObject interface defines the APIs that a non-visual component must implement in order to work properly with the MXML compiler.
Implementing this interface means that an RPC service can be used in an MXML document via tags since it supports the interfaces specified during Flex 1.
The IndexChangedEvent class represents events that are dispatched when an index changes.
InstanceCache is a utility that governs the task of creating and managing a set of n object instances, where n changes frequently.
The int class lets you work with the data type representing a 32-bit signed integer.
InteractiveIcon is the abstract base class for the operating system icons associated with windows and applications.
The InteractiveObject class is the abstract base class for all display objects with which the user can interact, using the mouse and keyboard.
The InterpolationMethod class provides values for the interpolationMethod parameter in the Graphics.beginGradientFill() and Graphics.lineGradientStyle() methods.
This error is thrown when a category specified for a logger contains invalid characters or is malformed.
This error is thrown when a Channel can't be accessed or is not valid for the current destination.
This error is thrown when a destination can't be accessed or is not valid.
This error is thrown when a filter specified for a target contains invalid characters or is malformed.
Flash Player throws this exception when it encounters a corrupted SWF file.
The NativeApplication object of an AIR application dispatches an InvokeEvent event when the application is invoked.
The event that indicates an RPC operation has been invoked.
The IOError exception is thrown when some type of input or output failure occurs.
An IOErrorEvent object is dispatched when an error causes a send or load operation to fail.
The IOLAPAttribute interface represents an attribute within a dimension of an OLAP schema.

The IOLAPCell interface represents a cell in an OLAPResult instance.
The IOLAPCube interface represents an OLAP cube that holds an N-dimensional representation of a flat data set.

The IOLAPDimension interface represents a dimension in an IOLAPCube instance.
The IOLAPElement interface defines a base interface that provides common properties for all OLAP elements.
The IOLAPHierarchy interface represents a user-defined hierarchy in a dimension of an OLAP schema.
The IOLAPLevel interface represents a level within the OLAP schema of an OLAP cube, where a hierarchy of a dimension contains one or more levels.
The IOLAPMember interface represents a member of a level of an OLAP schema.
The IOLAPQuery interface represents an OLAP query that is executed on an IOLAPCube.
The IOLAPQueryAxis interface represents an axis of an OLAP query.
The IOLAPResult interface represents the result of a query on an OLAP cube.
The IOLAPResultAxis interface represents an axis of the result of an OLAP query.
The IOLAPSchema interface represents the OLAP schema.

The IOLAPTuple interface represents a tuple.
The IOverride interface is used for view state overrides.
Defines the interface that a class must implement to be used as a download progress bar.
The IProgrammaticSkin interface defines the interface that skin classes must implement if they use the name property skin interface.
The IPropertyChangeNotifier interface defines a marker interface.
The IRawChildrenContainer interface defines the APIs for containers that can return an IChildList that represents all their children.
The IRectangularBorder interface defines the interface that all classes used for rectangular border skins should implement.
The IRepeater interface defines the APIs for Repeater public APIs of the Repeater object.
The IRepeaterClient interface defines the APIs for components that can have multiple instances created by a Repeater.
The IResourceBundle and IResourceManager interfaces work together to provide localization support for Flex applications.
The APIs of the IResourceManager interface provide localization support for Flex applications.
This interface provides the contract for any service that needs to respond to remote or asynchronous calls.
The Iris effect animates the effect target by expanding or contracting a rectangular mask centered on the target.
The IrisInstance class implements the instance class for the Iris effect.
This interface describes the properties and methods that an object must implement so that it can participate in the style subsystem.
Decodes the SOAP response for a particular operation.
An ISOAPEncoder is used to create SOAP 1.1 formatted requests for a web service operation.
The IStackable interface is implemented by any series that can be stacked.
The IStackable2 interface is implemented by any series that can be stacked.
The IStateClient interface defines the interface that components must implement to support view states.
Defines the interface that classes that define a line must implement.
This interface describes the properties and methods that an object must implement so that it can fully participate in the style subsystem.
Simple interface that defines an unload() method.
An ISystemManager manages an "application window".
Represents events that are dispatched when a navigation item on a navigator bar, such as a ButtonBar, LinkBar, or TabBar control, has been clicked.
This error is thrown when retrieving an item from a collection view requires an asynchronous call.
The ItemResponder class provides a default implementation of the mx.rpc.IResponder interface.
The IToolTip interface defines the API that tooltip-like components must implement in order to work with the ToolTipManager.
Components that implement IToolTipManagerClient can have tooltips and must have a toolTip getter/setter.
Interface providing methods for parsing and adding nodes to a collection of data that is displayed by a Tree control.
The ITreeDataDescriptor2 Interface defines methods for parsing and adding nodes to a collection of data that is displayed by a Tree control.
The IUIComponent interface defines the basic set of APIs that you must implement to create a child of a Flex container or list.
The IUID interface defines the interface for objects that must have Unique Identifiers (UIDs) to uniquely identify the object.
The IUITextField interface defines the basic set of APIs for UITextField instances.
The IURIDereferencer defines an interface for objects that resolve URIs in an XML signature.
The interface that components implement to support the Flex data validation mechanism.
Defines the interface for enumerating a collection view bi-directionally.
The IWindow interface defines the API for components that serve as top-level containers in Flex-based AIR applications (containers that represent operating system windows).
Decodes an XML document to an ActionScript object graph based on XML Schema definitions.
Encodes an ActionScript object graph to XML based on an XML schema.

An ActionScript type should implement this interface when it needs to instruct an XML Schema based encoder (such as the WebService SOAP client) which concrete type definition to use while encoding instances of the type.
The JointStyle class is an enumeration of constant values that specify the joint style to use in drawing lines.
The JPEGEncoder class converts raw bitmap images into encoded images using Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) compression.
The Keyboard class is used to build an interface that can be controlled by a user with a standard keyboard.
A KeyboardEvent object id dispatched in response to user input through a keyboard.
The KeyLocation class contains constants that indicate the location of a key pressed on the keyboard.
The Label control displays a single line of noneditable text.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Label control.
Flex defines a default, or Application, container that lets you start adding content to your module or Application without explicitly defining another container.
The LayoutManager is the engine behind Flex's measurement and layout strategy.
The Legend control adds a legend to your charts, where the legend displays the label for each data series in the chart and a key showing the chart element for the series.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Legend class.
The LegendData structure is used by charts to describe the items that should be displayed in an auto-generated legend.
Controls the individual legend elements in a chart legend.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the LegendItem class.
The LegendMouseEvent class represents event objects that are specific to the chart legend components.
The Linear class defines easing functions to implement linear motion with Flex effect classes.
The LinearAxis class maps numeric values evenly between a minimum and maximum value along a chart axis.
The LinearGradient class lets you specify the fill of a graphical element, where a gradient specifies a gradual color transition in the fill color.
The LinearGradientStroke class lets you specify a gradient filled stroke.
The LineChart control represents a data series as points connected by a continuous line.
All logger target implementations that have a formatted line style output should extend this class.
A simple implementation of a line segment renderer that is used by LineSeries objects.
The LineScaleMode class provides values for the scaleMode parameter in the Graphics.lineStyle() method.
Defines a data series for a LineChart control.
Defines the methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the LineSeries class.
Represents the information required to render an item as part of a LineSeries.
Represents all the information needed by the LineSeries to render.
Represents the information required to render a segment in a LineSeries.
A LinkBar control defines a horizontal or vertical row of LinkButton controls that designate a series of link destinations.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the LinkBar control.
The LinkButton control is a borderless Button control whose contents are highlighted when a user moves the mouse over it.
The skin for all the states of a LinkButton.
The skin for the separator between the Links in a LinkBar.
The List control displays a vertical list of items.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the List control.
The ListBase class is the base class for controls that represent lists of items that can have one or more selected and can scroll through the items.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ListBase class.
The ListBaseContentHolder class defines a container in a list-based control of all of the control's item renderers and item editors.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ListBaseContentHolder class.
An object that stores data about a seek operation that was interrupted by an ItemPendingError error.
Records used by list classes to keep track of what is selected.
The ListCollectionView class adds the properties and methods of the ICollectionView interface to an object that conforms to the IList interface.
The ListData class defines the data type of the listData property implemented by drop-in item renderers or drop-in item editors for the List control.
The skin for the drop indicator of a list-based control.
The ListEvent class represents events associated with items in list-based controls such as List, Tree, Menu, and DataGrid.
Constants for the values of the reason property of a ListEvent object where the value of the type property is ListEvent.ITEM_EDIT_END.
The default drag proxy used when dragging from a list-based control (except for the DataGrid class).
The ListItemRenderer class defines the default item renderer for a List control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the ListItemRenderer class.
The ListItemSelectEvent class represents event objects that are dispatched when an item in a list-based control such as a Menu, DataGrid, or Tree control is selected or deselected.
Used by the list-based classes to store information about their IListItemRenderers.
The Loader class is used to load SWF files or image (JPG, PNG, or GIF) files.
This class acts as a context for the messaging framework so that it has access the URL and arguments of the SWF without needing access to the root MovieClip's LoaderInfo or Flex's Application class.
The LoaderContext class provides options for loading SWF files and other media by using the Loader class.
The LoaderInfo class provides information about a loaded SWF file or a loaded image file (JPEG, GIF, or PNG).
The LoaderUtil class defines a utility method for use with Flex RSLs.
This event is dispatched when a WSDL XML document has loaded successfully.
The LocalConnection class lets you create a LocalConnection object that can invoke a method in another LocalConnection object.
The Locale class can be used to parse a locale String such as "en_US_MAC" into its three parts: a language code, a country code, and a variant.
Provides pseudo-hierarchical logging capabilities with multiple format and output options.
The LogAxis class maps numeric values logarithmically between a minimum and maximum value along a chart axis.
Represents the log information for a single logging event.
Static class containing constants for use in the level property.
The logger that is used within the logging framework.
The MaskEffect class is an abstract base class for all effects that animate a mask, such as the wipe effects and the Iris effect.
The MaskEffectInstance class is an abstract base class that implements the instance class for the MaskEffect class.
The Math class contains methods and constants that represent common mathematical functions and values.
The Matrix class represents a transformation matrix that determines how to map points from one coordinate space to another.
The MaxAggregator class implements the maximum aggregator.
The MemoryError exception is thrown when a memory allocation request fails.
The Menu control creates a pop-up menu of individually selectable choices, similar to the File or Edit menu found in most software applications.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the Menu control.
A MenuBar control defines a horizontal, top-level menu bar that contains one or menu items.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the MenuBar control.
The skin for the background of a MenuBar.
The MenuBarItem class defines the default item renderer for the top-level menu bar of a MenuBar control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the MenuBarItem class.
The MenuEvent class represents events that are associated with menu activities in controls such as Menu, MenuBar, and PopUpMenuButton.
The MenuItemRenderer class defines the default item renderer for menu items in any menu control.
Defines methods and properties required to perform instrumentation for the MenuItemRenderer class.
The MenuListData class defines the data type of the listData property implemented by drop-in item renderers or drop-in item editors for the Menu and MenuBar control.
The MenuShowEvent class represents events that are associated with menuBar.
The MessageAckEvent class is used to propagate acknowledge messages within the messaging system.
The MessageAgent class provides the basic low-level functionality common to message handling for a destination.
The MessageEvent class is used to propagate messages within the messaging system.
The MessageFaultEvent class is used to propagate fault messages within the messaging system.

The MessagePerformanceUtils utility class is used to retrieve various metrics about the sizing and timing of a message sent from a client to the server and its response message, as well as pushed messages from the server to the client.
The MessageResponder class handles a successful result or fault from a message destination.
This error indicates a problem serializing a message within a channel.
This is the base class for any messaging related error.
The MetadataEvent class defines the event type for metadata and cue point events.
Use the Microphone class to capture audio from a microphone attached to a computer running Flash Player or Adobe AIR.
The MinAggregator class implements the minimum aggregator.
Provides a logger target that outputs to a LocalConnection, connected to the MiniDebug application.
The base class for MXML-based dynamically-loadable modules.
The base class for ActionScript-based dynamically-loadable modules.
The ModuleEvent class represents the event object passed to the event listener for events related to dynamically-loaded modules.
ModuleLoader is a component that behaves much like a SWFLoader except that it follows a contract with the loaded content.
The ModuleManager class centrally manages dynamically loaded modules.
The MorphShape class represents MorphShape objects on the display list.
The methods of the Mouse class are used to hide and show the mouse pointer.
A MouseEvent object is dispatched into the event flow whenever mouse events occur.
The Move effect changes the position of a component over a specified time interval.
Represents event objects that are dispatched when a Flex component moves.
The MoveInstance class implements the instance class for the Move effect.
The MovieClip class inherits from the following classes: Sprite, DisplayObjectContainer, InteractiveObject, DisplayObject, and EventDispatcher.

Like a Consumer, a MultiTopicConsumer subscribes to a destination with a single clientId and delivers messages to a single event handler.
A MultiTopicProducer sends messages to a destination with zero or more subtopics.
The Namespace class contains methods and properties for defining and working with namespaces.
The NameUtil utility class defines static methods for creating names for Flex objects.
Represents this native AIR application.
Defines string constants for the names of the drag-and-drop actions.

Coordinates drag-and-drop operations.
Specifies which drag-and-drop actions are relevant to a drag operation.
The NativeMenu class contains methods and properties for defining menus.

The NativeWindow class provides an interface for creating and controlling native desktop windows.

Specifies the initialization options for constructing a new NativeWindow.
